sentences.en: A dashing horse bowled him over.
sentences.cn: 一匹狂奔的马将他撞倒.

sentences.en: Dashing in the dark night, in your pumpkin, searching the crystal.
sentences.cn: 南瓜马车的午夜, 找寻你的玻璃鞋.

sentences.en: He looked very dashing in his new suit.
sentences.cn: 他穿着那套新衣服显得很有精神.
他身穿时髦的服装当众露面.

sentences.en: He was a dashing figure and one that people turned to look at.
sentences.cn: 他身材魁伟,在他面前走过的人都不觉回头看看.

sentences.en: He was the very model of the dashing RAF pilot.
sentences.cn: 他正是风度翩翩的英国皇家空军飞行员的典范。

sentences.en: I must be dashing off now.
Little mountain stream is dashing down to the plain.
sentences.cn: 小山涧奔腾而下,流向平原.

sentences.en: Once in , they set up another pit - a - pat by dashing themselves against the chimney of the lamp.
sentences.cn: 他们一进来, 又在玻璃的灯罩上撞得丁丁地响.

sentences.en: There she lay dashing her head against the arm of the sofa.
sentences.cn: 她躺在那里,用头猛撞沙发扶手.

sentences.en: To them it offers a romantic appeal, usually symbolized by some dashing and characteristic figure.
sentences.cn: 它以自己的浪漫色彩来感召他们, 而这种浪漫色彩的象征通常是某个敢冲敢闯的具有超凡魅力的领袖人物.

sentences.en: Two elegant Scotsmen travelling together wore dashing kilts at dinner.
sentences.cn: 两名结伴旅行的优雅苏格兰男子就餐时穿了潇洒的苏格兰方格呢短裙。

sentences.en: Viewers will remember the dashing hero, Dirk, risking life and limb to rescue Daphne from the dragons.
sentences.cn: 观众不会忘记风度翩翩的男主角德克冒着生命危险把达芙妮从恶龙爪下救出的情形。

sentences.en: Who was it that had the dashing presumption to do that?
sentences.cn: 是谁这样大胆专横,使出这一手 呢 ?

words.tran_cn: 时髦地；华丽地；精力充沛地

phrases.tran_cn: v. 冲出，跑开；删去，勾掉

trans.tran_cn: 时髦的，华丽的，劲头十足的，打扮漂亮的，勇敢的，有锐气的
冲，猛冲(dash的现在分词)，猛掷
